Body:
Description: Hello Team,

Urgency here, SSO stoped working and is leading to loops in the login page. Let me know if you have availability for 26th or 27th this week to take a look and disable it through the backend.

Best regards,
Next Steps Updated: - Attend Zoom session and complete steps to reset access

What We've Learned Updated: - Customer reporting SSO not working and that server is not accessible
- Scheduled Zoom meeting for 12 PM BRT
- Requested that customer make a snapshot of current EPP Server

What We've Learned Updated: - Customer reporting SSO not working and that server is not accessible
- Scheduled Zoom meeting for 12 PM BRT
- Requested that customer make a snapshot of current EPP Server
- Joined Zoom Session
- Verified customer created snapshot
- Customer not able to log into the EPP console via the SSO account
- Disabled SSO log in via the backend
- Able to log into EPP console via root account
- Reconfigured log in using Microsoft Azure
- Customer still not able to log in using SSO yet able to log in using root user account.

- Customer is working on updating the security certificate 
- Customer requests to leave ticket open while they work through updating certs
Next Steps Updated: - Awaiting response from customer after they update the security certificates and reattempt SSO login

What We've Learned Updated: - Customer reporting SSO not working and that server is not accessible
- Scheduled Zoom meeting for 12 PM BRT
- Requested that customer make a snapshot of current EPP Server
- Joined Zoom Session
- Verified customer created snapshot
- Customer not able to log into the EPP console via the SSO account
- EPP server on 5.9.4.1
- Disabled SSO log in via the backend
- Able to log into EPP console via root account
- Reconfigured log in using Microsoft Azure
- Customer still not able to log in using SSO yet able to log in using root user account.

- Customer is working on updating the security certificate 
- Customer requests to leave ticket open while they work through updating certs
